publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Zachary Vickery.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Collection about the Fallbrook Recreation Center in Oswego, NY.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

bioghist.p: Excerpt from Fallbrook's website taken 11.18.2013: "Auxilary Services owns and operates the Fallbrook Recreation Center . . . facilities consist of a Ski Lodge and Barn that are available for use by reservation, and approximately 136 acres of scenic grounds and trails. . ."

scopecontent.p: Papers include: Fallbrook Nordic Ski Center project report - 1979. Correspondence relating to the same project - 1979.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

did.unittitle: Nordic Ski Center Feasibility Final Report

scopecontent.p:
Fallbrook Nordic Ski Center, Oswego, New York, feasibility final report. Sargent, Webster, Crenshaw & Folley - Architects, Engineers, Planners
This folder, 01-01, includes the first half of this report, pp. 1-63 Correspondence to Dr. Robert W. Rock from Herbert Boerner, AIA; Partner - Project Manager. Staff members who worked on this report and plan: Warren Ferguson, site design Michael Greenlee, chief design Manfred Diflo, design David Disinger, site design & graphics Barbara Dufford, editing and graphics Roy Kruse, modelmaker Paul Micho, printing
Table of Contents of entire report: I. The Project Philosophy and Goals II. The Program A. Outline B. Detail Analysis Drawings: Functional relationships of program requirements 1. Winter use 2. Summer use 3. Combined year-round use 4. Core buildings [The Village] III. The Site A. Location Analysis Area Map: Northeastern U.S. and Canada, showing location of site in relation to major population centers B. Site Analysis Drawing: Fallbrook property, including existing structures and land use, topography, drainage and natural features IV. The Master Plan A. Planning Philosophy B. Thompson Road C. The Observatory Property D. The Village E. The Cross-Country Stadium F. The Biathlon Stadium G. The Parcours H. The Running and Bicycling Trail I. The Downhill Ski Area J. The Ski Jump Area K. The Velodome L. The Amphitheatre M. The Human Performance Laboratory N. Utilities V. The Phasing Phases One through Five VI. Cost Estimate Summary Phases One through Five Appendix A The Building Program Building Drawings 1. Timing Shed 2. Trial Shelter 3. Administration Building/Ski Shop 4. Re-use, Brick Building 5. Human Performance Laboratory 6. Sauna 7. Amphitheatre [Concert Shell] 8. Ski Lift Building 9. Velodrome Appendix B Trail Maps 1. Cross-country: 5, 7.5, 10 and 15 km 2. Biathlon: 7.5, 10 and 20 km 3. Exercise Circuit [Parcours] 4. Bicycling and Running Trail Appendix C A review of similar existing facilities Master Plan Drawing

did.unittitle: Nordic Ski Center Feasibility Final Report

scopecontent.p:
Fallbrook Nordic Ski Center, Oswego, New York, feasibility final report. Sargent, Webster, Crenshaw & Folley - Architects, Engineers, Planners
This folder, 01-02, includes the first half of this report, pp. 65-back cover
Inside back cover is a pocket holding a folded master plan drawing map. The map area is from Route 104 to Cemetery Road. Elements include Rice Pond, Hilton Pond, Rice Creek Biological Field Station, Union Village Rural Cemetery, Brownell Road, Biathlon Stadium, Thompson Road, Velodrome, Cross-Country Stadium, parking lots, ampitheatre, ski jump, Rice Creek, the pond, the Village, Radio Tower Property and Observatory Property.

Correspondence relating to the Nordic Ski Center feasibility study. Correspondents include:
Correspondence from Robert W. Rock, project coordinator dated February 27, 1979 to Robert D. Charlebois, Carl G. Jahn, Darrell Rippeteau and Arthur M. Searor. Subject: invitation to firms to apply for job as consultant for the Nordic Ski Center feasibility study. A project description is attached along with an outline, map and preliminary draft of consultant's agreement. 2 copies

did.unittitle: Nordic Ski Center: proposal, plan, agenda, report

scopecontent.p:
Fallbrook Ski Center: proposal, plan, agenda, report . . .
Proposal of features of Fallbrook New York State Nordic Ski Center at Oswego. 2 pp.
Agenda for open meeting on Fallbrook Development. May 1981 at the Naval Militia Building. Participants: David Mead, Robert Rock, Herbert Boerner, Lynn Hemink, Charles Davis, Chris Gagas.
Nordic Ski Center project proposal report. Includes: functional relationship diagram; philosophy and goals; outline; detail analysis; phasing; cost estimate.
Blue examination booklet. First two pages have handwritten notes. No signature, no date. Rest of the booklet is empty.
Report: Oswego is Famous for its Snow. 18 pp. Prepared for the Speaker's Task Force on Sports and Physical Fitness. New York State Assembly: Stanley Steingut, Speaker William F. Passannante Estella B. Diggs Dennis T. Gorski Richard J. Conners Advisory Council: Robert J. Kane, Chairman James L. Anderson, Executive Director Contact: Dr. Robert W. Rock, Vice President for Student Affairs, SUNY Oswego. Elements of report: Annual snowfalls from 1966-1967 season to 1977-1978 season in Brooklyn, Lake Placid and Oswego, New York. Features of New York State Nordic Ski Center at Oswego. Spin-Off Benefits. Map of area. Photographs.
Quinlivan, Pierik and Krause/Architects and Engineers information/introduction sheets with business cards in folder. QP&K were candidates for Nordic Ski Center feasibility project.
Dames & Moore, Consultants in the Environmental and Applied Sciences. Information/introduction sheets in folder.
